input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Project Manager

Location: Honolulu, HI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Visit us at the NAVFAC Job Fair on Tuesday, April 30th from 9am to 5:30 pm at the Ala Moana Hotel, Garden Lanai Room, Honolulu, Hawaii
Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command, Pacific (NAVFAC Pacific) is looking for journey level Engineer Project Managers
The NAVFAC team offers innovative, exciting and meaningful work linking military and civilian talents to achieve our mission and safeguard our freedoms. Department of the Navy provides competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and extensive professional development and training.
A NAVFAC Project Manager provides independent, timely, and professional project management services for the planning, design and construction of assigned projects for the Navy, Marine Corps, and other Supported Commands, including special projects, military construction (MILCON), demolition, maintenance, space utilization and facilities development.
Consider joining a workforce where you can create a wave of change, even while on land.
As a Project Manager you will:Be responsible for the project management work related to the delivery of NAVFAC Design and Construction products and services for military construction and special projects.Plan and lead meetings and conferences required for execution of the project(s).Be responsible for tracking the progress of facility design to ensure execution remains within scope, budget, and on schedule.Identify and manage areas of risk associated with planning, design, and construction and develops mitigation strategies or alternatives. Engages and notifies appropriate stakeholder(s) for resolution when project exceeds scope, budget, or schedule. Makes final review of completed plans and specifications to make certain funds are adequate to cover estimated cost and within authorized scope.Participate as a member of the AE selection boards and provides recommendations for contract awards. Assists in the negotiation of AE contracts, and provides direction consistent with Navy policy to AE firms.Leads/serves on Best Value Source Selection boards for construction contractors; leads/serves on Technical Evaluation Teams, and provides recommendations for contract awards.
Salary: $93,143 - $140,155A Cost-of-Living-Allowance (COLA) of 8.9% will be added to the stated salary
Position Requirements:SECRET ClearanceRegistered Professional Engineer
Benefits:Our health insurance program offers you choice and flexibility to suit individual or family needs with no exclusions for pre-existing conditions, as well as a substantial employer contribution to premiums. Other health benefits include Dental and Vision Insurance programs, Flexible Spending accounts, Long Term Care Insurance and Federal Employees Group Life Insurance Program with no physical required for initial enrollment.
We offer an outstanding three-part Retirement Program encompassing our Federal Employees Retirement System, Thrift Savings Plan – a 401(k) type plan with employer contributions up to 5%, and Social Security benefits.
Additional benefits include paid holidays, sick and vacation leave, alternate work schedules, and telework may be authorized for eligible positions.
Most of all, as a NAVFAC civilian employee you can serve your nation and support America’s warfighter.
If this sounds like an opportunity and benefits you are interested in, please apply!
Requirements for all NAVFAC Positions:A US Citizen aged 18 or older at time of hireMales registered or exempt from Selective Service www.sss.govDetermined suitable for federal employment (process includes a background check and fingerprinting)New employees to the Department of the Navy will need to pass the E-Verify employment verification check.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Engineering Project Manager
output_json.summary: Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command, Pacific (NAVFAC Pacific) is seeking journey level Engineer Project Managers.
job_responsibilities: Responsible for project management work related to the delivery of NAVFAC Design and Construction products and services for military construction and special projects.
Plans and leads meetings and conferences required for execution of the project(s).
Tracks the progress of facility design to ensure execution remains within scope, budget, and on schedule.
Identifies and manages areas of risk associated with planning, design, and construction and develops mitigation strategies or alternatives.
Engages and notifies appropriate stakeholders for resolution when project exceeds scope, budget, or schedule.
Makes final review of completed plans and specifications to ensure funds are adequate to cover estimated cost and within authorized scope.
Participates as a member of the AE selection boards and provides recommendations for contract awards.
Assists in the negotiation of AE contracts and provides direction consistent with Navy policy to AE firms.
Leads/serves on Best Value Source Selection boards for construction contractors; leads/serves on Technical Evaluation Teams, and provides recommendations for contract awards.
benefits: Health insurance program with choice and flexibility, no exclusions for pre-existing conditions, substantial employer contribution to premiums.
Federal Employees Group Life Insurance Program with no physical required for initial enrollment.
Outstanding three-part Retirement Program including Federal Employees Retirement System, Thrift Savings Plan – a 401(k) type plan with employer contributions up to 5%, and Social Security benefits.
Paid holidays, sick and vacation leave, alternate work schedules, and telework may be authorized for eligible positions.
output_json.company_information: Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command, Pacific (NAVFAC Pacific)
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: US Citizen aged 18 or older at time of hire, Males registered or exempt from Selective Service, determined suitable for federal employment (includes background check and fingerprinting), new employees to the Department of the Navy will need to pass the E-Verify employment verification check.

other.content: $93,143 - $140,155 with a Cost-of-Living-Allowance (COLA) of 8.9% added to the stated salary
